get.summary: Get all the peers and their associated BFD state. Peers are identified by IP

put.summary: Add a new peer to the daemon. A session for the specified peer will start

delete.summary: Remove the specified peer from the daemon. The associated peer session will

AddPathElement.description: The add path element comes as a BGP capability extension as described in RFC 7911.

safi.description: Subsequent address family identifier. There are a large pile of these <https://www.iana.org/assignments/safi-namespace/safi-namespace.xhtml>

send_receive.description: This field indicates whether the sender is (a) able to receive multiple paths from its peer (value 1), (b) able to send multiple paths to its peer (value 2), or (c) both (value 3) for the <AFI, SAFI>.

checker.description: Checker rhai code to apply to ingress open and update messages.

originate.description: Complete set of prefixes to originate. Any active prefixes not in this list will be removed. All prefixes in this list are ensured to be in the originating set.

peers.description:
Lists of peers indexed by peer group. Set's within a peer group key are a total set. For example, the value

```text {"foo": [a, b, d]} ``` Means that the peer group "foo" only contains the peers `a`, `b` and `d`. If there is a peer `c` currently in the peer group "foo", it will be removed.

shaper.description: Checker rhai code to apply to egress open and update messages.

AsPathType.description: Enumeration describes possible AS path types

oneOf.description: The path is to be interpreted as a set
The path is to be interpreted as a sequence

asn.description: ASN of the router to get imported prefixes from.

fanout.description: Maximum number of equal-cost paths for ECMP forwarding
Current maximum number of equal-cost paths for ECMP forwarding

detection_threshold.description: Detection threshold for connectivity as a multipler to required_rx

listen.description: Address to listen on for control messages from the peer.

peer.description: Address of the peer to add.

required_rx.description: Acceptable time between control messages in microseconds.

BfdPeerState.description: The possible peer states. See the `State` trait implementations `Down`, `Init`, and `Up` for detailed semantics. Data representation is u8 as this enum is used as a part of the BFD wire protocol.

oneOf.description: A stable down state. Non-responsive to incoming messages.
The initial state.
The peer has detected a remote peer in the down state.
The peer has detected a remote peer in the up or init state while in the init state.

Capability.description: Optional capabilities supported by a BGP implementation.

oneOf.description: Multiprotocol extensions as defined in RFC 2858
Route refresh capability as defined in RFC 2918.
Outbound filtering capability as defined in RFC 5291. Note this capability is not yet implemented.
Multiple routes to destination capability as defined in RFC 8277 (deprecated). Note this capability is not yet implemented.
Multiple nexthop encoding capability as defined in RFC 8950. Note this capability is not yet implemented.
Extended message capability as defined in RFC 8654. Note this capability is not yet implemented.
BGPSec as defined in RFC 8205. Note this capability is not yet implemented.
Multiple label support as defined in RFC 8277. Note this capability is not yet implemented.
BGP role capability as defined in RFC 9234. Note this capability is not yet implemented.
Graceful restart as defined in RFC 4724. Note this capability is not yet implemented.
Four octet AS numbers as defined in RFC 6793.
Dynamic capabilities as defined in draft-ietf-idr-dynamic-cap. Note this capability is not yet implemented.
Multi session support as defined in draft-ietf-idr-bgp-multisession. Note this capability is not yet supported.
Add path capability as defined in RFC 7911.
Enhanced route refresh as defined in RFC 7313. Note this capability is not yet supported.
Long-lived graceful restart as defined in draft-uttaro-idr-bgp-persistence. Note this capability is not yet supported.
Routing policy distribution as defined indraft-ietf-idr-rpd-04. Note this capability is not yet supported.
Fully qualified domain names as defined intdraft-walton-bgp-hostname-capability. Note this capability is not yet supported.
Pre-standard route refresh as defined in RFC 8810 (deprecated). Note this capability is not yet supported.
Pre-standard prefix-based outbound route filtering as defined in RFC 8810 (deprecated). Note this is not yet implemented.
Pre-standard outbound route filtering as defined in RFC 8810 (deprecated). Note this is not yet implemented.
Pre-standard multisession as defined in RFC 8810 (deprecated). Note this is not yet implemented.
Pre-standard fully qualified domain names as defined in RFC 8810 (deprecated). Note this is not yet implemented.
Pre-standard operational messages as defined in RFC 8810 (deprecated). Note this is not yet implemented.
Experimental capability as defined in RFC 8810.

CeaseErrorSubcode.description: Cease error subcode types from RFC 4486

oneOf.description: All routes received carrying a communities attribute containing this value MUST NOT be advertised outside a BGP confederation boundary (a stand-alone autonomous system that is not part of a confederation should be considered a confederation itself)
All routes received carrying a communities attribute containing this value MUST NOT be advertised to other BGP peers.

All routes received carrying a communities attribute containing this value MUST NOT be advertised to external BGP peers (this includes peers in other members autonomous systems inside a BGP confederation).
All routes received carrying a communities attribute containing this value must set the local preference for the received routes to a low value, preferably zero.
A user defined community

ErrorCode.description: This enumeration contains possible notification error codes.

ErrorSubcode.description: This enumeration contains possible notification error subcodes.

FsmStateKind.description: Simplified representation of a BGP state without having to carry a connection.

oneOf.description: Initial state. Refuse all incomming BGP connections. No resources allocated to peer.
Waiting for the TCP connection to be completed.
Trying to acquire peer by listening for and accepting a TCP connection.
Waiting for open message from peer.
Waiting for keepaliave or notification from peer.
Sync up with peers.
Able to exchange update, notification and keepliave messages with peers.

Message.description: Holds a BGP message. May be an Open, Update, Notification or Keep Alive message.

MessageHistory.description: Message history for a BGP session

MessageHistoryEntry.description: A message history entry is a BGP message with an associated timestamp

NotificationMessage.description: Notification messages are exchanged between BGP peers when an exceptional event has occurred.

error_code.description: Error code associated with the notification

error_subcode.description: Error subcode associated with the notification

asn.description:
Autonomous system number of the sender. When 4-byte ASNs are in use this value is set to AS_TRANS which has a value of 23456.

Ref: RFC 4893 7

hold_time.description: Number of seconds the sender proposes for the hold timer.

OptionalParameter.description: The IANA/IETF currently defines the following optional parameter types.

oneOf.description: Code 0
Code 1: RFC 4217, RFC 5492 (deprecated)
Code 2: RFC 5492
Unassigned
Code 255: RFC 9072

asn.description: ASN of the router to originate from.
ASN of the router to originate from.

PathAttributeType.description: Type encoding for a path attribute.

flags.description: Flags may include, Optional, Transitive, Partial and Extended Length.

type_code.description: Type code for the path attribute.

PathAttributeTypeCode.description: An enumeration describing available path attribute type codes.

oneOf.description: RFC 4271
RFC 6793

PathAttributeValue.description: The value encoding of a path attribute.

oneOf.description: The type of origin associated with a path
The AS set associated with a path
The nexthop associated with a path
A metric used for external (inter-AS) links to discriminate among multiple entry or exit points.
Local pref is included in update messages sent to internal peers and indicates a degree of preference.
This attribute is included in routes that are formed by aggregation.
Indicates communities associated with a path.
The 4-byte encoded AS set associated with a path
This attribute is included in routes that are formed by aggregation.

PathOrigin.description: An enumeration indicating the origin type of a path.

oneOf.description: Interior gateway protocol
Exterior gateway protocol
Incomplete path origin

Prefix2.description: This data structure captures a network prefix as it's laid out in a BGP message. There is a prefix length followed by a variable number of bytes. Just enough bytes to express the prefix.

asn.description: Autonomous system number for this router

oneOf.description: All routes (IPv4 and IPv6)
BGP routes only
Static routes only
